title: Wacker Chemie’s earnings and sales rise
text:
Wacker Chemie AG on Thursday said its third-quarter earnings rose, boosted by a one-off compensation payment.

The German chemical company WCH, -0.68% said its aftertax profit for the period rose to 86.3 million euros ($95.9 million) in the third quarter, compared with EUR68.9 million a year earlier.

Earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization increased to EUR272.9 million from EUR241.7 million, it said.

Ebitda was boosted by an insurance compensation of EUR112.5 million. Adjusted for this figure, Ebitda declined 34%, Wacker said.

Last week, the company reported sales for the quarter, which edged up to EUR1.27 billion from EUR1.24 billion in the same period last year.

The company is working on a cost-saving program and will review its operations in the coming weeks, it said.

Last week, the company cut its full-year guidance due to low prices for polysilicon.

It expects full-year revenue to be in line with last year’s, rather than the previously announced mid-single-digit percentage increase. Net income is expected to be slightly positive and Ebitda is expected to fall around 30%, compared with a previous forecast of a 10-20% decline.
